Nutrition is the science that deals with the interaction of nutrients and other food components with the body. It encompasses the study of nutrient requirements, the processes by which nutrients are absorbed, metabolized, and utilized, and the consequences of nutrient deficiencies or excesses. Nutritionists examine the role of macronutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, and fats) and micronutrients (vitamins and minerals) in maintaining optimal health and preventing disease. The field of nutrition is multidisciplinary, drawing on concepts from biochemistry, physiology, and epidemiology. Research in nutrition aims to understand the complex relationships between diet, lifestyle, and health outcomes, and to inform evidence-based recommendations for dietary guidelines and public health policies. By integrating knowledge from various scientific disciplines, nutritionists work to advance our understanding of the intricate relationships between food, health, and disease.
